akas: Glee: Em Busca da Fama Brazil
Glee: Road to Sectionals USA (DVD box title)
akas from release info: Glee: Em Busca da Fama Brazil
Glee: Road to Sectionals USA (DVD box title)

1.title: Loser Like Me
1.plot: After a failed attempt to make it as an actress, Rachel comes to Lima, only to find out that the arts are completely vanished from McKinley. Now she finds herself in the position of taking over the Glee club, because Mr. Schue is leading Vocal Adrenaline now and Blaine is leading The Warblers.

2.title: Homecoming
2.plot: Quinn, Puck, Brittany, Santana, Artie, Mercedes and Tina are back in Lima to help the Glee Club.

3.title: Jagged Little Tapestry
3.plot: Sue becomes concerned when Becky brings a surprise guest to town. Rebuilding the glee club proves difficult for Rachel and Kurt.

4.title: The Hurt Locker: Part 1
4.plot: Rachel proposes an idea to Mr. Shuester in order to improve the club's chance at the invitational. Meanwhile, Sue conjures up a plan (with the unintentional help of Sam) to destroy the Glee club once again.

5.title: The Hurt Locker: Part 2
5.plot: The final of the competition between Warblers, Vocal Adrenaline and New Directions is here. Meanwhile, Kurt and Blain are trapped in an elevator with a Sue-Saw-Marionette.

6.title: What the World Needs Now
6.plot: Brittany and Santana have to do some convincing; Mercedes encourages Rachel to go for her Broadway dreams.

7.title: Transitioning
7.plot: Will takes desperate measures to teach the bullies of Vocal Adrenaline about tolerance. Meanwhile, New Directions rallies to help Rachel transition into her new life when she finds out her childhood home has been sold.

8.title: A Wedding
8.plot: The New Directions are busy working and planning, while, with a wedding upcoming, Sue has a change of heart and encourages everyone to follow their own.

9.title: Child Star
9.plot: The members of New Directions must come together to prepare for their first public performance.

10.title: The Rise and Fall of Sue Sylvester
10.plot: When Dalton Academy burns to the ground, the Warblers must combine with New Directions.

11.title: We Built This Glee Club
11.plot: New Directions and the Warblers face off; Rachel must choose between NYADA and Broadway.

12.plot: Flashbacks to the original New Directions members joining the club.

13.title: Dreams Come True
13.plot: The glee club members realize their dreams.

1.title: Pilot
1.plot: High school teacher Will Schuester tries to reinvent McKinley High School's Glee Club.

2.title: Showmance
2.plot: Glee Club performs in front of the school for the first time and surprises everyone in the audience. Meanwhile, Rachel realizes her feelings for Finn.

3.title: Acafellas
3.plot: Will forms an all-male acapella vocal group, spending more time building his own confidence and more time away from the Glee Club.

4.title: Preggers
4.plot: Kurt tries out for the football team in order to impress his dad. Sandy and Sue join forces to carry out their plans for destroying Glee Club.

5.title: The Rhodes Not Taken
5.plot: Will thinks the glee club desperately needs more of an edge, so he brings in his former classmate, April Rhodes, to spice things up. Will's plan seems to be going smoothly until he realizes he may be losing a key member of the club.

6.title: Vitamin D
6.plot: Will challenges the kids to a healthy dose of competition with boys against girls in a mash-up showdown. Meanwhile, Terri takes a job as the school nurse, despite having no medical experience, to keep an eye on Will.

7.title: Throwdown
7.plot: Sue tries to cause dissension among the Glee Club members, but the real showdown begins when she and Will get called into the principal's office.

8.title: Mash-Up
8.plot: Inspired the by the students, Will composes a mash-up for a very special occasion. Meanwhile, in a shocking reversal of roles, McKinley High's cool kids are dethroned in an "icy" fashion, and Sue shows off her softer side.

9.title: Wheels
9.plot: When Artie may not be able to travel to Regionals with the group, Will challenges the kids to experience life from a different point of view.

10.title: Ballad
10.plot: Will splits up the Glee Club into pairs to sing ballads, but when one kid gets sick, Will is forced to step in and winds up in a sticky situation.

11.title: Hairography
11.plot: Concerned that Sue is up to no good, Will pays a visit to an instructor of a competing glee club to see what information she might be leaking.

12.title: Mattress
12.plot: When Glee Club is left out of the yearbook due to budget cuts, everyone's relieved that they won't have to suffer the ridicule of years past.

13.title: Sectionals
13.plot: Sectionals is finally here for the Glee Club, but when Quinn's secret unravels, the club may not be able to recover in time to compete.

14.title: Hell-O
14.plot: With an extra spring in their step, Glee Club works on new numbers for Regionals, but their efforts are undermined by Rachel and Finn's romance.

15.title: The Power of Madonna
15.plot: Concerned that the Glee Club girls are being bullied by the guys, Mr. Schuester challenges the kids to choose Madonna songs as their next assignment.

16.title: Home
16.plot: When Kurt sets his dad, Burt, up with an unexpected partner, his plan for a nuclear family may backfire.

17.title: Bad Reputation
17.plot: Will starts an investigation when a salacious list about members of the Glee Club circulates the halls of McKinley High.

18.title: Laryngitis
18.plot: When a sore throat affects Rachel's singing voice, she goes into panic mode. Meanwhile, Kurt tries to change his persona to impress his father.

19.title: Dream On
19.plot: Will's former high school nemesis, Bryan Ryan, causes trouble for Glee Club. Rachel struggles with a life-long personal issue.

20.title: Theatricality
20.plot: Will encourages the Glee Club to express themselves using the music of Lady Gaga. Meanwhile, Tina embraces her inner Goth.

21.title: Funk
21.plot: Glee Club gets some bad news. Meanwhile, Mercedes helps Quinn connect with her funky side, and Will gets revenge on Sue.

22.title: Journey to Regionals
22.plot: When Regionals finally arrive, Sue pulls a fast one on the Glee Club, and their chances at the title could be compromised.

1.title: Audition
1.plot: New faces challenge some Glee Club veterans during auditions, while new and old relationships leave some feeling happy, and others sad.

2.title: Britney/Brittany
2.plot: Brittany has hallucinations while at the dentist and channels her inner Britney Spears. Rachel fears her relationship with Finn could be in peril.

3.title: Grilled Cheesus
3.plot: Finn believes he sees the face of Jesus in a grilled cheese sandwich, and random events have the members of the Glee Club questioning religion and God.

4.title: Duets
4.plot: Will's duet challenge, with a free meal for the winners, causes some relationship issues between the members of the club.

5.title: The Rocky Horror Glee Show
5.plot: On a jealous impulse, Will decides to stage "The Rocky Horror Picture Show" as the school play, and Sue encourages him for devious reasons.

6.title: Never Been Kissed
6.plot: Will hosts the second annual Boys vs. Girls competition, while Puck finally gets out of juvenile detention.

7.title: The Substitute
7.plot: A substitute teacher takes over for a sick Will and wows the group with her unconventional teaching methods.

8.title: Furt
8.plot: Sue plans a wedding where her mom wants to sing; Kurt plans the wedding of his dad and Finn's mom. Will Finn face down Kurt's tormentor?

9.title: Special Education
9.plot: New Directions face fierce competition against the Hipsters and Warblers. Finn and Rachel and Emma and Carl experience relationship trouble.

10.title: A Very Glee Christmas
10.plot: Finn tries to get everyone at McKinley High into the holiday spirit. Sue paints herself up as the Grinch to steal back presents.

11.title: The Sue Sylvester Shuffle
11.plot: A huge halftime performance is planned during the championship football game at McKinley High. Sue's Cheerios have trouble at the Regionals.

12.title: Silly Love Songs
12.plot: As Valentine's Day approaches, it's all about romance, connections, hope, stolen kisses, heartbreak, and spite.

13.title: Comeback
13.plot: Sue is depressed since her loss at Regionals. Brittany starts a new fashion trend at school to the dismay of Rachel who showed her what to wear.

14.title: Blame It on the Alcohol
14.plot: Will has the Glee Club perform a song about underage drinking, but the message might lose impact when they come to school with hangovers.

15.title: Sexy
15.plot: Holly Holliday returns to McKinley High to teach sex education to the students. Puck and Lauren join the celibacy club.

16.title: Original Song
16.plot: New Directions wants to get an edge at the Regionals and decides to use original songs. Blaine wants to try a new strategy during Regionals.

17.title: A Night of Neglect
17.plot: Will tries to come up with ways to raise money to send the kids to the Nationals. Sandy forms "the Heckling Club" with eyes on the glee team.

18.title: Born This Way
18.plot: Finn accidentally breaks Rachel's nose during dance rehearsals. The campaign to become prom queen heats up between the girls.

19.title: Rumours
19.plot: Brittany's new internet talk show spreads like wildfire around the school. April returns to McKinley High after an unsuccessful attempt on Broadway.

20.title: Prom Queen
20.plot: The prom arrives. The glee club performs as a substitute band, Kurt wants to have a good time with Blaine, while Quinn and Santana vie for the crown.

21.title: Funeral
21.plot: Coach Sylvester tries to sabatoge the New Directions' trip to New York. The Glee Club performs songs at a funeral. Finn has bad news for Quinn.

22.title: New York
22.plot: The Glee Club gets ready to perform at the Nationals in New York. Finn and Rachel have an emotional moment on stage during the competition.

1.title: The Purple Piano Project
1.plot: After a devastating loss at Nationals, Will assigns the kids a new project to get them back on track.

2.title: I Am Unicorn
2.plot: Shelby Corcoran returns to McKinley High. Meanwhile, Will initiates a boot camp for some of the members of Glee Club.

3.title: Asian F
3.plot: Emma's parents come for a visit, and Mike struggles with his grades while his parents work to get him back on track.

4.title: Pot O' Gold
4.plot: A new foreign exchange student enrolls at McKinley High and crashes with Brittany, who thinks he's a leprechaun.

5.title: The First Time
5.plot: The kids prepare to perform the school musical "West Side Story", while Finn meets with a recruiter.

6.title: Mash Off
6.plot: Sue starts a smear campaign to take down her biggest competitor for the congressional seat.

7.title: I Kissed a Girl
7.plot: As the race for McKinley High president comes to an end, someone is caught trying to fix the results.

8.title: Hold on to Sixteen
8.plot: In an attempt to recruit a few more members, Finn tracks down former teammate Sam Evans and convinces him to come back to the Glee Club.

9.title: Extraordinary Merry Christmas
9.plot: When the Glee Club is asked to perform at two different events, on the same day, at the same time, they have a difficult decision to make.

10.title: Yes/No
10.plot: When Will tries to plan a special suprise for Emma, he enlists the Glee Club to help him sweep her off her feet.

11.title: Michael
11.plot: The rivalry between New Directions and the Warblers intensifies en route to Regionals. Kurt and Rachel receive news about NYADA.

12.title: The Spanish Teacher
12.plot: Will assigns the Glee Club a Spanish singing assignment and enlists the help of his musically enclined night school teacher.

13.title: Heart
13.plot: In honor of Valentine's Day, Will challenges the Glee Club to find and perform the world's greatest love songs.

14.title: On My Way
14.plot: Things heat up as New Directions goes head-to-head with the Dalton Academy Warblers at Regionals.

15.title: Big Brother
15.plot: Much to Blaine's chagrin, his big-shot Hollywood actor brother, Cooper, comes to visit.

16.title: Saturday Night Glee-ver
16.plot: New Directions pays homage to the film "Saturday Night Fever" by grooving to the disco-infused dance numbers.

17.title: Dance with Somebody
17.plot: The Glee Club covers Whitney Houston's greatest hits, while Will and Emma become one step closer to their dream wedding.

18.title: Choke
18.plot: Rachel and Kurt finally get their chance to audition for the NYADA.

19.title: Prom-asaurus
19.plot: Brittany goes into high gear as class president to spearhead the prom. Then, after nominations are announced, the kids kick into campaign mode.

20.title: Props
20.plot: When Tina bumps her head, the world of New Directions is turned upside down in her eyes.

21.title: Nationals
21.plot: When Mercedes comes down with a bad case of food poisoning, Will drafts Tina and Quinn to sub for her.

22.title: Goodbye
22.plot: Graduation is finally here, and McKinley High's class of 2012 looks to the past and present while contemplating the future.

1.title: The New Rachel
1.plot: The members of New Directions compete to become the next star of the Glee Club, and a fresh crop of students is introduced.

2.title: Britney 2.0
2.plot: Brittany, in a funk, turns to the music of Britney Spears for inspiration. Rachel struggles to adjust to life in New York City.

3.title: Makeover
3.plot: The campaign showdown begins when Brittany and Blaine go head-to-head for student council president. Meanwhile, Kurt lands his dream internship.

4.title: The Break-Up
4.plot: In New York City, Rachel and Kurt are caught off guard by unexpected visitors. Meanwhile, Santana and Brittany adjust to their long-distance relationship.

5.title: The Role You Were Born to Play
5.plot: As auditions for the school production of "Grease" get under way, Marley, Jake, Kitty and Ryder compete for the lead roles.

6.title: Glease
6.plot: Rachel and Kurt pay a visit to Lima as the Glee Club launches its production of "Grease." Meanwhile, Santana returns to lend a helping hand.

7.title: Dynamic Duets
7.plot: Marley, Jake, and Ryder find themselves in the midst of a love triangle. Meanwhile, Blaine has a run-in with the Warblers.

8.title: Thanksgiving
8.plot: Some McKinley alumni give New Directions advice about Sectionals. Elsewhere, Rachel and Kurt have a nontraditional Thanksgiving dinner.

9.title: Swan Song
9.plot: As New Directions regroups after Sectionals, Finn ponders his future with the club. Meanwhile, Kurt gets a shot at redemption with a second audition.

10.title: Glee, Actually
10.plot: As 2012 draws to a close, Sam and Brittany live life to the fullest before the Mayan apocalypse. Meanwhile, Kurt has a Christmas he'll never forget.

11.title: Sadie Hawkins
11.plot: The Glee Club girls organize a Sadie Hawkins dance at McKinley High. Sam looks for evidence that the Warblers cheated at Sectionals.

12.title: Naked
12.plot: The Glee Club puts together a calendar photo shoot for a fundraiser. Meanwhile, a part in a student art film poses a moral dilemma for Rachel.

13.title: Diva
13.plot: Finn challenges the Glee Club members to find their inner powerhouses for "Diva Week." Emma prepares for her upcoming wedding.

14.title: I Do
14.plot: Will and Emma tie the knot on Valentine's Day, with current and former members of New Directions reuniting in Lima to celebrate.

15.title: Girls (and Boys) on Film
15.plot: As everyone recovers from Will and Emma's wedding, the Glee Club members are tasked with performing their favorite movie songs.

16.title: Feud
16.plot: The students give Will and Finn an assignment to work out the tension between them. Meanwhile, Santana is suspicious about Brody's side job.

17.title: Guilty Pleasures
17.plot: The members of New Directions perform songs that they're ordinarily too embarrassed to admit that they love.

18.title: Shooting Star
18.plot: As the members of New Directions prepare for Regionals, an unthinkable event occurs and puts matters into perspective.

19.title: Sweet Dreams
19.plot: New Directions gets ready for Regionals, where "Dreams" will be the theme. Rachel auditions for a Broadway revival of "Funny Girl."

20.title: Lights Out
20.plot: When the power goes out at McKinley High, the Glee Club members go back to the basics and perform acoustic numbers.

21.title: Wonder-ful
21.plot: The Glee Club performs Stevie Wonder's greatest hits. Meanwhile, Artie receives news that could affect his future.

22.title: All or Nothing
22.plot: It's time for Regionals, and the Glee Club is more determined than ever to advance to Nationals. Meanwhile, Brittany returns with a new attitude.

2.title: Tina in the Sky with Diamonds
2.plot: The Glee Club continues their celebration of the works of The Beatles. Also Tina's ego begins to become unmanageable with her nomination for prom queen. Meanwhile New love begins to blossom for Sam and Santana respectively.

4.title: A Katy or a Gaga
4.plot: The members of New Directions tackle their assignment of getting out of their comfort zones and determining whether they're more like "Katy" (Perry) or (Lady) "Gaga." Kurt holds auditions for his new band and must decide if he'll let in the overly bold performer, Starchild. Meanwhile, Jake gets closer to Bree as he and Marley grow apart.

5.title: The End of Twerk
5.plot: The glee club learns the dance of the hour: twerking. Meanwhile, Marley discovers Jake's relationship with Bree, and Rachel tries to convince Kurt that they both should get tattoos.

6.title: Movin' Out
6.plot: The New Directions pay homage to the Piano Man: Billy Joel. As graduation looms closer, the seniors make plans for their futures beyond the halls of McKinley.

7.title: Puppet Master
7.plot: Blaine believes he has the best plan to win Nationals, but he doesn't take the glee club's criticism too well when the students accuse him of being too controlling. Over in New York, Kurt also runs into control issues when the band disagrees over the venue of their first official gig that Kurt booked. Meanwhile, Sue reveals the story behind her iconic tracksuit and gets in touch with her feminine side.

8.title: Previously Unaired Christmas
8.plot: Jane Lynch introduces the episode as a Christmas special that FOX did not allow to air from last year. The New Directions audition for roles in McKinley's living Nativity Scene. Meanwhile in New York, Rachel, Kurt and Santana work as Santa's elves at a mall.

9.title: Frenemies
9.plot: Keep your friends close and your frenemies closer.

10.title: Trio
10.plot: Sam, Blaine and Tina want to enjoy their last moments together in High School. Kurt has problems with the band because of Rachel and Santana's fight. Will and Emma try to get pregnant.

11.title: City of Angels
11.plot: The new direction are headed to Nationals, but not quite as they plan.

12.plot: The glee club members are saying goodbye to each other when two old guests come and attempt to the save club.

13.title: New Directions
13.plot: The Glee club is finally coming to an end and the members of New Directions say their farewells to Mr. Schuster. Rachel and Santana get to the core of their quarrels and sing it out in traditional Glee style.

14.title: New New York
14.plot: Mercedes, Sam, Artie, and Blaine are in New York.

15.title: Bash
15.plot: Sam and Mercedes cross difficult hurdles in the road to love. Rachel's "mid-winter critique" performance leads her to a crossroads where she has to choose between NYADA and her role as Fanny. Kurt is attacked by a group of homophobes.

16.title: Tested
16.plot: Sam and Mercedes as well as Kurt and Blaine encounter trouble in their relationship; Artie regrets his decisions.

17.title: Opening Night
17.plot: Nervous for opening night, Rachel is willing to do anything to succeed. When she finds out that Jacob Ben Isreal is writing a review of the show for the New Yorker, her director pressures her to do whatever it takes for a good review.

18.title: The Back-Up Plan
18.plot: Reaching for the stars, when Rachel lands an audition to act in a TV show, Funny Girl takes a back seat, but it's not without some serious consequences; Meanwhile Kurt and Blaine perform for a celebrity with an eye for talent.

19.title: Old Dog, New Tricks
19.plot: As Rachel faces criticism for being a slacker, Santana makes sure her public image doesn't degrade. Kurt feels that his friends don't support him as much as he does them and Sam adopts a dog but has Mercedes to deal with.

20.title: The Untitled Rachel Berry Project
20.plot: Rachel meets a famous television writer, whose eccentric personality catches Rachel off guard. Meanwhile, Sam and Mercedes deal with the pressure of commitment as their careers take off, and the time has finally come for Blaine's big showcase with June Dolloway at NYADA. Musical performances include "Shakin' My Head", "All Of Me", "Girls On Film", "Glitter In The Air", "No Time At All ", "American Boy", and "Pompeii'.

locations: Paramount Studios - 5555 Melrose Avenue, Hollywood, Los Angeles, California, USA::(studio)
Alex Theatre - 216 North Brand Boulevard, Glendale, California, USA
imdb.plot outline: When a High School Spanish teacher, Will Schuester, becomes the director of the school's failing Glee club, New Directions, he hopes to be able to rejuvenate it. The club competes in the choir competition circuit. It's been called "a High School Musical for adults", the series follows the club and its mixture of oddball members as they try and restore it to its former glory. It is a musical comedy in which the eager and ambitious students not only compete to win the Nationals, but also have to deal with the tough and cruel realities of their school, McKinley High. At the same time, Will is trying to rejuvenate his failing love life whilst preventing the school's cheer leading coach Sue Sylvester from sabotaging the choir.
imdb.title: Glee
plot: A group of ambitious misfits try to escape the harsh realities of high school by joining a glee club.

When a High School Spanish teacher, Will Schuester, becomes the director of the school's failing _Glee_ (qv) club, New Directions, he hopes to be able to rejuvenate it. The club competes in the choir competition circuit. It's been called "a High School Musical for adults", the series follows the club and its mixture of oddball members as they try and restore it to its former glory. It is a musical comedy in which the eager and ambitious students not only compete to win the Nationals, but also have to deal with the tough and cruel realities of their school, McKinley High. At the same time, Will is trying to rejuvenate his failing love life whilst preventing the school's cheer leading coach Sue Sylvester from sabotaging the choir.::WellardRockard

When a high school Spanish teacher becomes the new glee club coach (a clubs he was previously in) he takes on a group of very different but talented students. Training a glee club has never been so amusing. New bonds created and friends for life made. Get ready for "New Directions"::Alicia Jayne

McKinley High School, in Lima Ohio, is forever changed when Spanish teacher Will Schuester revives the school's show choir. As Will begins to recruit members for his dancing and singing glee club, he realizes that his ragtag group of high school outcasts could become a sensation. The students who take a chance on glee club soon become life-long friends as they battle school humiliation, heartbreak, loneliness, and bullying. When glee club proves to be very good and talented, the school's cheerleading coach (Sue Sylvester) takes it upon herself to destroy the club and everyone involved with it. As glee club is thrown numerous challenges by the high school popular kids, rivalling show choirs, and Sue, Will won't give up on the budding student stars. Will faces phenomenal stress levels as he deals with one of his students (Kurt Hummel) being mercilessly bullied, trying to meet the diva that is Rachel Berry's high demands, mentoring football jock Finn Hudson (who is confused by all the elements of his life), two of his students dealing with teen pregnancy, and desperately trying to fix his toxic marriage. Through all of this drama, glee club must win their competitions if they want to continue existing. The show also focuses on the McKinley alumni after graduation; following Kurt and Rachel navigating the scary streets of New York, the other graduates scrambling to make it big in California, and Will who tries to get a second generation of glee clubbers. _Glee_ (qv) explores the ups and downs of high school life and love while emphasizing the importance of equality in schools and the world and also sharing light on the countless problems that face students and school faculty today.
synopsis: It's also about the lives of crazy teenagers and singing famous songs sung by famous artists.

camera: Panavision Panaflex Millennium XL2, Panavision Primo Lenses
